I don't even know who this Mr. Sinclair is, but he wrote about us for a book.
translation.ko: 싱클레어가 누군지 몰라도 책에 우리 얘길 썼어요

translation.en: I used to quote it word for word.
"I saw our richest newspaper publisher keep his movie mistress

furnished with shiploads of junk imported from Europe
and surrounded by vast acres reserved for use by zebras and giraffes,
translation.ko: '얼룩말과 기린이 노니는 드넓은 초원으로 둘러싸여 있다'

translation.en: telling in jest that he had spent six million dollars
to make his lady's reputation
and using his newspapers to celebrate her change of hats."
translation.ko: '애인이 새 배역을 맡으면 기사를 싣기도 한다'

translation.en: It must be hard to be on the receiving end of that.
People think because you're on the cover of Modern Screen, they know you.
translation.ko: 잡지 표지만 보고도 날 안다고 생각하죠

translation.en: Nerts! What do I have to complain about?
I live in a fishbowl, but anything I want is mine.
translation.ko: 우물 안 개구리지만 원하는 건 전부 있어요

translation.en: If I could, I'd share with everyone. You know that, Mank.
translation.ko: 나눌 수 있다면 나눌 거예요 알잖아요, 맹크

translation.en: This Upton doesn't know a thing about the real…
Nobody, but nobody, makes a monkey out of William Randolph Hearst!
translation.ko: 아무도 윌리엄을 바보 취급할 순 없어!

translation.en: I understand why Mayer loathes him.
-Why? -Sinclair caught him with his pants down.
translation.ko: - 메이어는 그자를 싫어할 만해요 - 왜요? - 치부를 들켰거든요 - 저런!

translation.en: Yikes!
He wrote that Mayer took a bribe to look the other way
translation.ko: 메이어가 뇌물을 받고 경쟁사의 MGM 인수 작전을 모른 체했다는 글을 썼어요

translation.en: so a rival could buy MGM.
translation.ko: 경쟁사의 MGM 인수 작전을 모른 체했다는 글을 썼어요

translation.en: -It's complicated. -Over my head?
No, over mine. You'd need a degree in larceny.
-Isn't bribery a crime? -That's what Sinclair said.
translation.ko: - 뇌물 수수는 범죄죠? - 싱클레어도 그렇게 말했고

translation.en: The little sausage might have gone to jail.
Jeepers!
The hypocrisy.
"Mayn gantze mishpokhe. My mishpokhe."
-I don't speak a lot of Jewish. -Really?
"My mishpokhe. My family."
Everything he does is for family,
except when it comes to selling his last name
to a competitor in the middle of the night.
He would do that to his own studio?
He doesn't own MGM any more than Sam Goldwyn.
translation.ko: 샘 골드윈도 메이어도 MGM 진짜 주인은 아니에요

translation.en: They just run it for the moneyboys back East.
And jail is not something an animal like Mayer is likely to forget.
translation.ko: 그런 짐승 같은 인간은 원한을 쉽게 못 잊어요

translation.en: Irving must be clean.
He looks like he shaves three times a day.
translation.ko: 면도를 하루 세 번은 하는 것 같던데요

translation.en: Well, there's clean, and there's clean.
Irving bought one of Sinclair's novels.
Sinclair demanded a guarantee that not one word could be changed,
translation.ko: 싱클레어는 단어 한 글자도 바꾸지 말라고

translation.en: in writing, on the back of the purchase check.
He didn't want notes from Irving Thalberg?
When Thalberg refused, Sinclair took his money
and ran off to Mexico and financed a picture about the Russian Revolution.
translation.ko: 멕시코에서 러시아 혁명 영화에 자금을 댔어요

translation.en: Now, that's sticking the old neck out.
I'm sorry. Instinct!
My fault.
I've been a little sixes and sevens recently.
Tell me something, Mank. The truth.
Could you see me playing
Elizabeth Barrett Browning or Marie Antoinette?
translation.ko: 마리 앙투아네트 역을 소화할 수 있을까요?

translation.en: Irving's bought 'em both. You know, because of Pops.
What do you think?
And honestly.
I see you more as Dulcinea.
-Who? -Dulcinea.
From the Spanish, for sweetness.
"Her hair, gold."
"Her cheeks, roses."
Nice.
"Her lips, coral."
"Her neck, alabaster." "Her bosom, marble."
Marble? Maybe once.
"Ivory, her hands, and her whiteness, snow."
translation.ko: '상아 같은 손 새하얀 눈 같은 피부'

translation.en: -You wrote that? -No. A fella named Cervantes.
"There are meters of accent and meters of tone,
but the best of all meters is to meet her alone."
-A poem with a message. -That's just the first verse.
The last?
"There are letters of accent and letters of tone,
but the best of all letters is to let her alone."
Now, those, I wrote.
Do come in.
Jesus! What is that? Sunlight. It's nearly noon.
Mother of God! Where did the night go?
-Your support device is here. -Good. Send it in.
translation.ko: - 보조 장치가 도착했어요 - 잘됐군, 갖고 와

translation.en: As is Mr. Houseman.
What would you like me to do?
Well, send him in, too.
Put it over there, please.
-You're early. -I thought we should talk.
-Why are you wearing a coat? -I always wear a coat.
Must be 108 degrees.
We're at a Rubicon moment, Mank.
It's not the work. That's everything we hoped it would be.
-Enough room there? -It should be.
I'm sorry, John.
-You've only written 90 pages. -Ninety-one.
In my expert opinion, you're hardly out of the first act.
I mean, how do you hope to be done in 14…
13 days?
We gave him our solemn word we would deliver.
-"We"? -I don't think he's going to take it well.
You said 90 days. Welles said 60. I'm doing the very best I can.
translation.ko: 자넨 90일, 웰스는 60일 난 최선을 다하고 있어

translation.en: -We are surely to be axed. -Not just yet.
translation.ko: 이러다간 둘 다 모가지예요 이따 해

translation.en: I've never been fired.
-I've never not been fired. -I don't get fired.
It's not as unpleasant as you might imagine.
You worry too much, John. What do you do for pleasure?
Hello?
Yes, he's here.
It's Orson.
-Will you talk? -He'd like to speak with Mr. Houseman.
Me?
Orson.
I came early to see where we were with…
No, not at all. Everything's going absolutely according…
Well, that's difficult to say exactly.
Yep. Yes, I know the clock…
Well, as I've told you, it's quite unique.
In fact, I'd say one of the most…
Yes, well, it will absolutely need your marvelous…
He's on the mend and working tirelessly.
translation.ko: 몸도 좋아지고 있고 집필에 힘쓰고 계셔

translation.en: Of course. When?
I'm on my way. Yes. Hang on, he's right here.
He wants to see me right away. Wouldn't tell me why.
Perhaps he will you.
Orson!
Tell me what's up, Mank.
He's getting on my nerves.
I sensed that. I told him I had to see him.
Hopefully, I can think of a reason before he gets here.
I've finished my test for Heart of Darkness.
I'm turning my attention to our project.
"Let there be light."
-Tell me what to expect. -I thought you'd want to be surprised.
You're always surprising. That's why you were my only choice.
translation.ko: 늘 놀라운 작품을 쓰니 제가 맹크 씨를 택한 겁니다

translation.en: No one else is Mankiewicz. I can almost hear the finish line.

translation.ko: - 이제 반환점 돌 참이야 - '또 한 번 나아가자!'

translation.en: Slim, you may tote those lovely highland beauties to the kitchen.
translation.ko: 슬림, 내 귀여운 스카치들 주방에 쌓아줘

translation.en: Fraulein Freda, empty the Mickeys and start replacing their contents. Raus. Schnell.

translation.en: -Thank you, Slim. You may go. -Slim.
Mr. Mankiewicz, please don't ask us to help you in this sad deception.

translation.en: My dear Mrs. Alexander,

translation.ko: 찰리랑 얼마나 공들여 준비한 건데 딱하다니?

translation.en: My deadline is two weeks away, and I intend--

translation.ko: 난 잠들기 전에 머리가 제일 잘 돌아

translation.en: And I am sick and tired of having my evenings end

-You're not? -I am telling you.

-Fraulein Freda. -Ja, Herr Mank?
-Please do as I instructed. -Ja, Herr Mank.
You mustn't let him intimidate you.
I'm not intimidated, Frau Alexander.
Then, why?
Herr Mank sponsored my family's entry into this country.
He's responsible for us getting safely out of Germany, legally and financially.
translation.ko: 독일에서 합법적으로 안전하게 나올 수 있게요

translation.en: -Really? -Our entire village, he brought here.
Entire village? Over 100 people.
Joseph Goebbels, the propaganda minister,

I didn't realize.
He wrote a picture about the Nazis which no studio anywhere will dare make.
translation.ko: 다른 데선 엄두도 못 낼 나치 영화를 썼죠

translation.en: I assume if he wishes to drink, he's a grown man, a good man,

translation.en: and should be treated as such.
Nicht wahr?
To Mank-town. Or is it Mank-ville?
Dear Freda.

translation.ko: 독일어로 입 싼 사람을 뭐라고 하지?

translation.en: Either you demonstrate you can handle this,

There's nothing like a vote of confidence from one's peers.
To Mank-berg. Prosit.
Mank-heim. Bottoms up.
Hey, Mank, you remember me?

C.C. for Central Casting. How you been, Mank?
What happened?

I ain't had so much as a walk-on since Tugboat Annie.

translation.en: Listen, I hate to, you know…
Yeah. Ed, lend me a buck.

In certain echelons, it's common knowledge.
Well, people in certain echelons

But the studios aren't moving anywhere. That's company-town propaganda.
translation.ko: 스튜디오는 어디 안 가 그건 그냥 선동이야

translation.en: Believe what you want, but, say, you think you could spare…
Ed?
Bless you, Mank.
The bastard reneged. You were there.
translation.ko: 그 자식이 약속을 깼어 형도 봤잖아

translation.en: Yes, he reinstated salaries, but he never gave back the money he promised.
translation.ko: 월급은 원상 복귀했지만 삭감액은 안 돌려줬어

translation.en: Giant surprise.
Come on, Mank. We need guys like you to keep people like Mayer honest.
translation.ko: 그러지 말고 형 같은 사람이 잡아야지

translation.en: I'd refer you, for that, to the power of prayer.

translation.en: We're doing it for the $250-a-week guy.
Joe, all the $250-a-week writers I know are getting $2,500.
translation.ko: 내가 아는 그런 작가들은 결국 2천 넘게 받던데?

translation.en: Stop crying for your just deserts. They're liable to give them to you.
translation.ko: 자꾸 징징거리면 받을 것도 못 받아

translation.en: Then we'll all be working for 75 bucks a week.
I don't know if you've walked a picket line.
translation.ko: 피켓 라인 가 봤어? 한번 가 봐

translation.en: -You might have to. -And Dave Chasen will cater.
translation.ko: 피켓 라인 가 봤어? 한번 가 봐 데이브 체이슨이 한마디 하겠군

If that happens, you'd better run

translation.en: Hermie, the guild's in its infancy.

What writer failed to notice the Screen Writers Guild needs an apostrophe?

And look at him.
The most miserable bastard on God's green earth.
I'd tell him you said that, only he'd think you were brownnosing.
Close the door.
Summer.
Inez, you are not to let the brothers Marx wait in my office.

Sit down.
You wanted to see me?
Not that I care,

translation.en: Well, call me old-fashioned,

translation.en: How's it gonna look if the GOP chairman himself

translation.en: can't get unanimous support from his own studio?
translation.ko: 자기 스튜디오의 지지도 못 받으면 어떻게 보일까요?

translation.en: You're serious.
I was taught by my parents

I was encouraged by mine to use my imagination,

It's ten bucks, Mank. You piss that away between hopeless bets.
I hate to think what L.B. might do if he knew you were the only holdout.
translation.ko: 당신만 빠진 걸 알면 회장님이 어쩌실지

translation.en: -I am, and he doesn't? -And we're not gonna tell him.
translation.ko: - 나뿐이야? 루이스는 모르고? - 말 안 할 겁니다

translation.en: -I could let you go for this. -It is a hanging offense.
But I'll add the amount to your gambling debt and forget we ever had this conversation.
translation.ko: 도박 빚으로 처리할 테니 이 대화는 없었던 거로 하죠

translation.en: You do that… and the brand-spanking-new Writers Guild
translation.ko: 그렇게 해 새로 생긴 작가 협회랑

I'm not sure the guild intends to cover games of chance.
And you won't go to the press, because in California, that means Hearst.
Irving, you are the shrewdest executive in this town.
Why are you acting like some dumb ward heeler?
You don't need my donation.

translation.en: You don't need anybody's. You have everything it takes right here.
translation.ko: 내 돈이고 누구 돈이고 필요 없잖아 필요한 건 전부 갖고 있으니까

translation.en: Meaning?
Meaning you can make the world swear King Kong is ten stories tall

translation.ko: 메리 픽퍼드가 마흔에 처녀라 믿게 하지

translation.en: Yet, you can't convince starving voters that a turncoat socialist

translation.en: is a menace to everything Californians hold dear?
translation.ko: 캘리포니아의 본질을 위협한다고 믿게 하진 못하나?

translation.en: You're barely trying.
Millions of Californians are being taxed out of their homes,

Fruit rots on the ground, and vegetables are dumped into the ocean
translation.ko: 과일이 썩고 채소가 바다에 버려지고 있어요

translation.en: because there are no markets for them.
Aimee Semple McPherson says you're a godless commie, Upton!
Too often, sir, the religion of Jesus is used by the ruling classes
translation.ko: 그리스도교는 너무 흔히 지배층을 견고히 하고

translation.en: to keep themselves in power and the poor ever poorer.
And that, my friends, is a sin and an error.
I say, with Thomas Jefferson,
"Truth has nothing to fear from error where reason is left free to combat it."
My friends, income in this country

translation.ko: 두 방법 중 하나로 재분배될 겁니다

translation.en: legal enactment or violent revolution.
We haven't much longer to exercise our choice.
translation.ko: 고를 수 있는 날이 얼마 남지 않았습니다

translation.en: Thank you all for coming.
Tell us about Hollywood!
Are the studios really moving to Florida like they've been saying?
Absurd, sir.

Well, he may not get Mayer's vote, but he gets mine.
translation.ko: - 메이어는 몰라도… - 캘리포니아엔… - 나는 뽑을래 - 일자리가 생길 겁니다

translation.en: …in California.
Thank you all for coming.
Well, I have seen some miracles in my day, but I have over 200 pages in 13 days.
I never thought it possible.
To support devices. Support devices.
It's good, Mank. Damn good.
I have it on highest authority it's the best thing he's done.
As a moving picture, it's more than good.
I'm at a loss to even express how wealth and influence can crush a man.
It's Lear. The dark night of the soul.
And I was completely mistaken.
The shifting point of view is revolutionary.
I never thought one could care so much about a sled.
translation.ko: 썰매가 그렇게 중요할 수 있을 줄이야

translation.en: It's kind of you to say.
But.
"But," again.
It's 327 pages. An embarrassment of riches.
When the Dog-Faced Boy gets here, there will be branches to prune.
"A far too long screenplay for the ages." John Houseman.
translation.ko: '우리 시대엔 너무 긴 각본' 존 하우스먼

translation.en: I built him a watertight narrative and a suggested destination.
Where he takes it, that's his job.
I was looking to get you paid.
I don't know if you were aware or not.

-I needed the work. -You may want to reconsider.
All I currently want is a real shower, a cocktail, and my Sara to wake up to.
translation.ko: 샤워하고 칵테일 마시고 세라를 보고 싶어

translation.en: Are you certain?
It worked out.
Mank, if I may be so bold, why Hearst?
Lord knows, outside his own blonde Betty Boop,

John, are you familiar with the parable of the organ grinder's monkey?

Young man, I'm a widow,

translation.ko: 보잘것없긴 해도 이 자그마한 집이 내 전부죠

translation.en: -And I intend to protect it. -Poor old woman.
Would you mind telling the folks why you're voting for Frank Merriam?
Well, I'm voting for Frank Merriam because I wanna keep our way of life.
I know that voice.
It is familiar.
That's Maude Anderson.
It is. Aunt Bertha from Lonely Trails.
Well, she's no widow. And she's absurdly rich.
translation.ko: 과부는 무슨 돈도 썩을 만큼 많아

translation.en: That "poor old woman" has got enough oil wells south of El Segundo

I'd know that whiskey gargle anywhere.
translation.ko: 가래 끓는 목소리라 모를 수가 없어

translation.en: Hey, Mank.
Looks like you found work, C.C.
Don't nose it around, but yeah, just in the nick.

translation.en: Grady gets a speaking part.

I don't know who thought of it, but it keeps a lot of us off the streets.
Don't forget to vote.
Okay.

translation.en: I'm in.
Poor sap. Not only has he got no money, he's an idealist, for Christ's sakes.

Times says he'll lose by 200,000.

translation.en: Raise.

translation.ko: 집회에 입장료를 매기고 멍청이들이 모이면 기부금을 걷잖아

translation.en: Call.
He's the most famous schlub after FDR, Hitler, and Mussolini.

What? Now, Shelly?

I'm out.
Mind telling us who you favor in this fall's election?
-I'm going to vote for Frank Merriam. -Mind telling us your principal reason?
Well, I want Merriam because I want a job.
If you drive all the capital out of the country, who'll pay us?
translation.ko: 자본을 국외로 내보내면 우린 뭐로 삽니까?

Absolutely.
It's no time to trade horses in the middle of a stream.

-I most certainly am. -Who would you vote for?
translation.ko: - 이번에 투표하시나요? - 물론이죠 누굴 뽑으실 건가요?

translation.en: -I'm sure I'm gonna vote for Mr. Sinclair. -You must have a good reason to.
translation.ko: - 싱클레어로 맘이 가네요 - 이유가 있을 텐데요

translation.en: Well, Mr. Sinclair got something new. He got that EPIC Plan.

I need prosperity.
Well, first of all, I'm an American,

translation.ko: 모든 기반과 원칙을 지킬 것 같아요

My wife and I love California, and we'd like to stay.

Cut.
Mrs. Hammontree, mind telling the folks why you're voting for Frank Merriam?
Well, I'm voting for Frank Merriam because I wanna keep our way of life.
You don't believe a Democrat would protect your way of life?

translation.en: Why, that man's a socialist.
I don't know much about politics, but I do know this.
If Upton Sinclair wins this election,

Well, we need complete rejuvenation of our system,

His system work in Russia, why not here?

translation.en: Cut. Do it again.
What'd you think?
Truthfully, Shelly, if the performances were any better,

Only half of 'em were actors.
It's got that raw newsreel feel, hasn't it?
-But it isn't news, and it isn't real. -I wasn't looking to have a debate.
translation.ko: 하지만 아니잖아 시비를 가리잔 게 아냐

translation.en: -When did they cook this up? -At a meeting in production.

"America's unemployed will invade the Golden State."
-Mayer was giddy to use it against him. -Yeah, I bet he was.

translation.en: to an unsuspecting public than a party hack.
Manky--

Just nerves.

You don't think anyone old enough to vote's gonna buy this shit?
Only the ones who believe King Kong is ten stories tall

translation.en: or Mary Pickford a virgin at 40.

translation.en: when front-paged in the Times and backed by those tacky billboards.

translation.en: I'd call that a fair return on a one-minute lecture

Your director's been stricken with a bout of conscience.

Don't do this, Irving.

translation.en: Mayer's not paying for this.
He never pays for anything.
Willie?
-Marion might be interested. -Well, you're gonna have to hurry.
Mayer's over there now, giving her the company kiss-off.
Haven't you heard?
She's taking her playpen to Warner Bros.
Permanently.
-Warner's? -I wouldn't let her do Marie Antoinette.

Congratulations, Irving.
I know what I am, Mank.
When I come to work, I don't consider it slumming.

I go to the mat for what I believe in.

But you, sir,
how formidable people like you might be if they actually gave at the office.

Mank! Are you okay?

Cairo, I think.
-Can you phone him? -I don't phone him, he phones me.

After November 6th. I'm joining him in Europe next week.

And that's why he'd believe you.

translation.en: -Promise you won't laugh. -I promise I won't laugh.
-My exit. -What?

-Manky! -Whatie?
It's an ash-throated flycatcher! Congratulations. Best kind.

It's not about her, it's about him.
-Or rather, it's him, but it's not her. -It isn't?

What do you mean?

Are you going to say anything?

What does instinct tell you?

He took the script?

I don't know.
Do you want him to?
I don't know.
Sinclair is yesterday's fish-wrap.
Never stood a chance.
Make up your mind.

Mankiewicz, Herman.

Quite handsome.
Please, sit.

Thank you for this.
Why do I love you?
What's everyone else having?

"If you keep telling people something untrue,

Frank Merriam…
the good Republican,

It's Shelly.

Sleep it off.

He's shit-faced.

translation.en: Perfect place to dry out.

L'chaim.

News travels fast.
Even without the title page,

It's very…
complicated.

Herman, this is me.

Now, there's a first.
I exposed myself, not entirely metaphorically, in court.

It was the goddamn French pun that did me in.
I'm washed up, Joe.
Have been for years.
It's the best thing you've ever written.
A rare bird, that.
A Mankiewicz.
-You can't do it that way. -Do what?

translation.en: You're not the first person to trade integrity for a chance in the big chair.

translation.en: Thalberg said this was your idea.

Go home to Fay.
-Eve. -Eve. Sorry.

translation.en: We have to be vigilant. In regards to?
People sitting in the dark,

We have a huge responsibility.
I got it.
Got what?
Parkinson's.
No, Shelly.
I'm so sorry.
First, you get the tremors,
and your muscles begin to fail.
Pretty soon, you can't get out of a chair.
Then smiling, speaking, everything goes.
And it keeps going till…
You could always produce.
Give me the gun, Shelly.
Take 'em, Mank.
Go on home. I'll be fine.
Is he with you?
He wouldn't come.
Tell me you got the gun.
Oh, my God!
-What? -He had a whole box.
Mank.
You have another visitor.
What?
Drink it fast.
In this heat, it'll flash to sugar.
Why the wine and dine, Marion?
Good cop, bad cop?

Well, I read the script.

Willie, down?

but I had to loan him a million dollars just to save San Simeon.

You're the most observant man I know.

translation.en: -Then you deserve better. -That's very sweet.
I always wanted better.
Mama Rose, too.
She made sure her daughters learned to sing and dance.
We were never gonna end up in Brooklyn.
I was only 16 when I was cast in Stop! Look! Listen!

Willie came to the show. Same seat, every night.
translation.ko: 윌리가 매일 밤 같은 좌석에서 구경했죠

translation.en: And all the other girls said to watch out. He was too old for me and too interested.
Come now, he wasn't your only admirer.
The thing you got so right in your script…

When my own mother heard he was one of the richest men in America,

He has always been so kind to me.
I love the old guy, Mank.
Maybe I didn't always, back when he was my social security.

that no one could possibly…
Am I persuading you at all?
I hope, if this gets made,
you'll forgive me.
And I hope,
if it doesn't,
you'll forgive me.
He was a modest man.
His name never appeared on the marquee

translation.en: But he loved moving pictures more than he loved anything.

It is not for us to say why he was taken from us so unexpectedly.
Behind, he leaves his memory.
The memory of a great man, a talented man, a man of unblemished integrity.
Irving G. Thalberg.
Mank.

-How you been, Mank? -Between pictures.

translation.en: I couldn't get past your secretary's secretary.
Is that right?
Good to see you, Mank.
-Hello. -Mank?
One moment, please.
Mank.
Mank!
It's Orson.
It's Orson.
-Hello. -Mank.
I've just finished your first draft, and I must say,
I'm pleased and impressed.
-Are you? Good news. -It'll need work, of course.
But there are no problems that can't be solved together.
translation.ko: 힘을 합치면 못 할 게 없죠

translation.en: Well, I'm delighted to hear it.
Houseman's bringing my notes. Think about 'em.
Meantime, I'll run everything through my typewriter.
Everything will thank you.
You're in touch with your Hollywood crowd?
Good old Houseman.
Perhaps you've heard. None of the theater chains will touch us.
It looks like RKO will have to sue for restraint of trade.
They'll countersue, of course.
If you own any part of that lovely home of yours,
it might be a good idea to put it in Poor Sara's name.
translation.ko: 불쌍한 세라 이름으로 돌려놓는 게 좋아요

translation.en: -You still there, Mank? -Yes. Where else would I be?
I've saved the best for last.
Guess who phoned with an offer to buy out RKO's investment
and shelve the picture permanently.
-Not Hearst? -Mank, I'm surprised.
Would Othello snoop on Desdemona when he has Iago?
translation.ko: 오셀로한텐 이아고가 있는데 데스데모나를 직접 감시할까요?

translation.en: Mayer. What did RKO say?
No dice, but they're on their uppers. Whether they--
-You'd better drive up. -I plan to, as soon as I'm done--
Today, if possible.
Dear Jove, did I say something I shouldn't have?
I hope you haven't lost your nerve.
Nerve's about all I've got left.
What a year you've had, Louis. How have you weathered it?
Despite everything, the MGM ship, I'm happy to say, is full steam ahead.
We're on track with this recent slate for our most successful year ever.
Well, that's great news.
Would you like to go and lay down?
I think I'd rather stay upright.
-Perhaps we can find you a costume. -Well, why would I need a cost--
Hello, everyone. Better late than never.
Mank! Where's Sara?
Caring for clan Mankiewicz.
-And what train did you take? -Glendale. I missed my stop.
translation.ko: - 기차 어디서 타셨어요? - 글렌데일, 내릴 역을 놓쳐서

translation.en: Got a taxi from Morro Bay.
I'm confused. I thought the invitation called for circus attire, not flea circus.
I was cornered by a man who sold vacuum cleaners.
A show of hands, who knows what a vacuum cleaner is?
Martin, would you set a place for Mr. Mankiewicz,
somewhere where he might get some air?
Would you follow me this way, sir?
And offer him some coffee.
Yeah. Mr. Monkeywitz could use some coffee.
And how's Marie Antoinette coming together?
Previews have been a struggle for general audiences.
We made some trims, but I should've known.
Versailles, all those costumes and wigs.
You can't tell those stories without overhauling them for a modern audience.
How's the performance of your leading lady?
The picture depends upon her.
Norma put her heart and soul into it.
I should've insisted she take some time.
-It's a lot to deal with a loss like that. -Marion would've made it her own.
translation.ko: 얼마나 가슴이 아프겠어요 매리언을 써도 됐는데

translation.en: Marion would have been perfection.
-Marion Antoinette. -But it was Irving's picture.
translation.ko: 매리언 앙투아네트 - 하지만 어빙 거니까요 - 매리오네트

translation.en: Marionette.
I'm not interested in educating our customers.
You want to send a message? Call Western Union.
Literary pictures.
"Let them get cake."
Who needs to see that?
Joanna, come along now. I'll show you those horses we talked about.
She's very pretty.
Also, very bright, bullheaded, and British.
Are you here to try your luck, too, Schnutz?
-At what? -Changing my mind.
I never had much success with that, Herman.
You'll do what you need to.
Charlie's been here, Joe's been, Marion's been.
For one reason or another, all of them want me to walk away.
You care to hear what I've decided?
Not really.
After 20 years of connubial bliss,
blind loyalty can get a little suffocating.
Okay.
Here goes.
God knows I've rehearsed it enough.
I've raised your kids kosher and all but by myself.
translation.ko: 당신 자식들을 혼자 유대교에 따라 키웠어

translation.en: I've put up with your suicidal drinking,
your compulsive gambling, your silly platonic affairs.
translation.ko: 도박 중독에 여자 만나는 것도 참았어

translation.en: You owe me, Herman.
Joe says he can't promise,
but he thinks if you make nice with Mayer, you can have your old job back.
translation.ko: 메이어랑 화해하면 복귀할 수 있을 거래

translation.en: Is that what you want me to say? I know what your answer'll be,
translation.ko: 이런 말을 기대했어? 당신 대답은 아니까

translation.en: so don't ask me to give you Poor Sara's seal of approval.
Why do you put up with me, Schnutz?
My movie-star looks or my diplomat's charm?
I suppose because being married to you, Herman,
I'm never bored.
Exhausted, yes. Exasperated, usually.
But having devoted so much,
I have to stick around to see how it turns out.
And whatever you decide…
please be mindful of those who care about you most.
I'm going riding.
Haven't seen a horse's face in years.
And one last thing, Herman.
I don't want nobody calling me Poor Sara no more.
translation.ko: 불쌍한 세라라는 말 안 나오게 해

translation.en: I've got a great idea for a picture, Louis.
A picture I just know you're gonna love.
It's a modern-day version of Quixote.
Now, I know none of you read, but you know what it's about.
translation.ko: 책 안 읽는 여러분도 줄거리는 알죠

translation.en: A deluded old nobleman who tilts at windmills.
translation.ko: 풍차에 덤벼드는 정신 나간 귀족 이야기

translation.en: So how might we update this story?
-Do you want me to get someone? -No.
How about we make our Quixote…
a newspaperman?
Who else could make a living tilting at windmills?
translation.ko: 엉뚱한 곳에 덤벼드는 게 돈키호테랑 똑같잖아요

translation.en: But that's not enough.
No, he wants more than readership.
He wants more than adulation. He wants love.
So, he runs for public office, and because he's notably rich, he wins.
translation.ko: 그래서 선거에 나가고 돈이 많아서 당선돼요

translation.en: No, wait a minute.
Notably rich and powerful
can't win over an audience
unless notably rich and powerful sees the error of his ways in the final reel.
translation.ko: 마지막 순간 자신의 문제를 깨달아야 관객의 사랑을 받죠

translation.en: Notably rich and powerful
and making no goddamn excuses for it is only admirable in real life.
Isn't that right, Louis?
So what do we do?
Anybody?
We give him ideals.
Ideals that any dirt-poor,
translation.ko: 가난뱅이에 대공황에 지친 관객이 공감할 만한 이상 말입니다

translation.en: depression-weary audience can identify with.
translation.ko: 대공황에 지친 관객이 공감할 만한 이상 말입니다

translation.en: Our Quixote is against crooked trusts.
translation.ko: 주인공이 악덕 기업 합동을 반대한다고 합시다

translation.en: He's for the eight-hour workday, fair income tax, better schools.
translation.ko: 8시간 노동, 공정 소득세 공교육 개선을 지지하죠

translation.en: Why, he's even for government ownership of railroads.
You know what we call those people?
-Communists? -Anarchists?
No, our Quixote,
he's a two-fisted muckraker.
In fact, someone predicts that he will one day
translation.ko: 그리고 누군가가 말하죠 그는 언젠가 대통령에 당선돼 바라 왔던…

translation.en: win the presidency and bring about, get this…
translation.ko: 그는 언젠가 대통령에 당선돼 바라 왔던…

translation.en: a socialist revolution.
-What a bunch of bullshit! -Is it?
Tell him, Willie.
Tell him.
Upton Sinclair used exactly those words
to describe a young William Randolph Hearst.
-You miserable bastard! -How do you do?
Our Quixote, he hungers, he thirsts,
he lusts for the voters to love him.
Love him enough to make him president. But they won't, and they don't.
translation.ko: 하지만 대통령이 될 만큼의 사랑은 받지 못하죠

translation.en: How do you suppose that could happen?
Could it be because, in their hearts,
they know that he values power over people?
Disillusioned in Congress,
he authors not one single piece of legislation in two terms.
translation.ko: 두 번 재임하는 동안 단 하나의 입법안도 안 내요

translation.en: Can you believe that? That'll take some writing.
Placed in nomination for president,
but it's too radical for the boys in the back.
His bid goes nowhere, but we're doing something.
We're building sympathy.
Rejected, he flees to lotus land,
where his faithful troll, Sancho, has prepared a mythical kingdom.
translation.ko: 충실한 하인 산초가 마법의 궁전을 마련했죠

translation.en: Wait a minute.
I forgot the love interest.
Her name…
Dulcinea.
Funny, adventurous, smarter than she acts.
She's a showgirl,
beneath his social stratum, but that's okay,
because true love on the big screens,
we all know, is blind.
And she…
Yeah, she loves him, too.
So he takes her away to his mythical kingdom.
Can I get a bicarb?
Now, along comes nemesis.
That's Greek for any guy in a black hat.
Nemesis runs for governor, and he's a shoo-in to win.
Why?
Because he's exactly what our Don used to be.
An idealist, you get it?
And not only that,
nemesis is the same guy who once predicted
our Quixote would one day preside over a socialist revolution.
translation.ko: 언젠가 혁명을 일으킬 거라고 평가했던 바로 그 사람이에요

translation.en: Our Quixote looks into the mirror of his youth
translation.ko: 돈키호테는 거울 속에 자신의 젊은 시절이 비치자

translation.en: and decides to break this glass,
a maddening reminder of who he once was.
Assisted by his faithful Sancho
and armed with all the black magic at his command,
he does just this.
Destroying, in the process, not one man…
but two.
Well, what do you think, Louis?
You think it'll play?
Don't worry, folks.
The white wine came up with the fish.
Who the fuck do you think you are, Mankiewicz?
You're nothin' but a court jester.
And let me let you in on a little secret.
Do you have any idea who pays half your salary?
translation.ko: 누가 자네 봉급을 주는 것 같아?

translation.en: He pays half your fucking salary.
Him, you fucking ingrate.
You didn't know that, did ya? You wanna know why?
Because he likes the way you talk.
Not the way you write, the way you talk.
Don't that chap your ass?
-Please, follow me. -It's very quaint.
Rise and shine, hombre.
Shoot-out at the O.K. Corral.
Before we buckle down, you have something to get off your chest?
As a matter of fact, I do.
Frankly, I think what I said upset you.
I know your health's not what it might be, and that comes first.
translation.ko: 건강이 예전 같지 않으니 몸을 먼저 생각하셔야겠죠

translation.en: -Really? -This studio fuss, this lawsuit.
God knows what pressure's yet to come.
At your age, you'd be justified in wanting out.
translation.ko: 저도 그 나이면 빠지고 싶을 거예요

translation.en: I'm 43, but that's very understanding.
Mayer's buyout was rejected,
so the fat's only starting to hit the fire.
Now, I talked to RKO, and I'll tell you what they're ready to do.
In recognition of the outstanding work you've done so far,
they're prepared to relieve you of the rewrite and still honor your full pay…
How's that?
That's more than generous.
But I don't intend to walk.
All right.
What's bothering you, then?
You're not going to like this, Orson.
I want credit.
Come again?
It's the best thing I've ever written.
Jack, get me some Cuban cigars.
-In Victorville? -Do what you can, Jack.
Stay, Houseman. You'll miss the third act complicator.
translation.ko: 가지 마, 하우스먼 3막 갈등은 보고 가야지

translation.en: Get going, Jack. Muy pronto.
I believe that means right away.
Mank.
What I said was more in sorrow than in anger, Willie.
Are you familiar with the parable of the organ grinder's monkey?
Now, the organ grinder's monkey is tiny in stature,
and having been taken from the wild,
he's naturally overwhelmed by the enormous world around him.
But every morning, a sweet elderly woman dresses him in a fine suit of clothes.
translation.ko: 매일 아침 친절한 노부인이 멋진 옷을 입혀줘

translation.en: She fits him with a red velvet vest adorned with pearl buttons
translation.ko: 진주 단추로 장식된 붉은 벨벳 조끼랑

translation.en: and a handsome red fez with a silk tassel.
translation.ko: 실크 장식끈이 달린 멋들어진 붉은색 페즈

translation.en: She slips on brocade shoes that curl at the toe.
translation.ko: 노부인은 발가락 부분이 말려 올라간 양단 구두를 신고

translation.en: And he's paired with a fine gilt music box on an exquisite gold chain
translation.ko: 우아한 금 사슬이 달린 금박 오르골을

translation.en: fastened to his neck and his neck alone.
translation.ko: 다른 누구도 아닌 원숭이 목에 걸어줘

translation.en: Whenever he ventures into the city to perform, he thinks,
"What a powerful fellow I must be."
"Look how patiently everyone waits just to watch me dance."
Willie--
"And wherever I go," he thinks,
"this music box must follow, and with it, this poor downtrodden man."
"And if I chose not to dance, this sorry street peddler would starve,
translation.ko: '내가 춤추지 않으면 굶어 죽고 말 거야'

translation.en: and every time I do decide to dance, every time…
he must play."
"Whether he wishes to or not."
You've had a bit too much to drink, Herman.
I'll get Raymond to drive you to the station.
Goodbye.
Put aside gratitude, Mank.
That you've done your best work was no accident.
translation.ko: 최고의 작품은 우연히 나온 게 아니에요

translation.en: I removed any distraction, eliminated every excuse,
translation.ko: 방해랑 변명이 될 건 전부 치워줬죠

translation.en: your family, your cronies, liquor.
I gave you a second chance.
And for that, I cannot thank you enough.
But with credit for a risky undertaking must go the weight of real responsibility.
translation.ko: 하지만 크레딧에 오르면 큰 책임을 져야 해요

translation.en: Given your health, I wonder if you're up to it.
translation.ko: 건강도 안 좋은데 할 수 있겠어요?

translation.en: And frankly, I wonder too, but we'll find out.
You may never work in this town again, Mank!
Orson, please…
Then you force me to remind you!
We have a contract that you understood and agreed to.
If you fight this, it will go to what your new guild calls arbitration,
and you, my friend, will lose script, money,
and, assuming such a thing still exists in Hollywood,
the respect of those who honor their word.
How can I put this nicely?
I may be a loose cannon,
but you, my friend, are an outsider.
They're exasperated by me, and I've earned it,
translation.ko: 나야 화를 사도 달라질 것 없지만

translation.en: but you, a self-anointed savior-hyphenate,
they're just waiting to loathe you.
Remind me never again to work with a washed-up alcoholic!
Duly noted. Nelson Algren, please copy.
All right! No doubt you'll get your credit.
But ask yourself, "Who's producing this picture?"
"Directing it? Starring in it?"
That's what we need when Susan leaves Kane.
translation.ko: 수전이 케인을 떠날 때 그걸 넣어야겠군

translation.en: An act of purging violence.
Maybe.
Mank, where are you?
Mank, come quick!
He's alive!
Ian's alive!
-He fetched up on the Orkneys! -The what?
The Orkney Islands, you idiot.
Mank, are you ever serious?
Only about something funny.
And the winner of the best original screenplay is…
Herman J. Mankiewicz…
and Orson Welles for Citizen Kane.
This is the first nomination and first win for Mr. Mankiewicz and Mr. Welles.
translation.ko: 맹키위츠 씨와 웰스 씨의 첫 수상인데

translation.en: Neither were able to attend tonight.
Accepting for both is the president of RKO Radio Pictures, Mr. George Schaefer.
translation.ko: RKO 픽처스의 조지 섀퍼 회장께서 대신 수상하시겠습니다

translation.en: -Excuse me, Mr. Welles. -Good morning, gentlemen.
translation.ko: "1942년 브라질 리우데자네이루" - 질문요, 웰스 씨 - 안녕하세요

translation.en: Morning, Mr. Welles. You missed a big night.
Well, I was unable to attend the Academy Awards
because I'm here in Rio making a marvelous motion picture.
Kane was nominated in nine categories, including best actor.
Aren't you disappointed that it only won one Oscar?
Well, that, my good man, is Hollywood.
Anything you'd like to say to your coauthor, Mr. Mankiewicz?
I do have a brief message.
You may tell him from me…
"Mank, you can kiss my half!"
You ask me what my acceptance speech might have been.
Well, here goes.
I am very happy to accept this award
translation.ko: 무척 기쁩니다 이 상을 받을 때에도

translation.en: in the manner in which the screenplay was written,
which is to say, in the absence of Orson Welles.
translation.ko: 그때도 지금도 오슨 웰스 없이 혼자니까요

translation.en: How's that?
How come he shares credit?
Well, that, my friend, is the magic of the movies.
Hold up the Oscar, Mank. Big smile.
